title: MSSQL Mode - Unable to save New Connection or New Folder
author: thornt5748
body_snippet:
All,
I'm having issues getting MSSQL connection to work, connects to DB fine but prompts error messages when attempting to create a new Connection or New Folder.

mRemoteNG version: 1.77.0.41252
SQL: SQL Server 2019

I receive the following different errors, when I try and tweak the first one, I receive the second one.
ErrorMsg
08/19/2020 16:33:50
Couldn't save connections file as ""!
Cannot insert the value NULL into column 'RedirectAudioCapture', table 'mRemoteNG.dbo.tblCons'; column...

comments.snippet:
I also have an issue using MSSQL mode, but I get a different error:
```
8/28/20 9:01:22
VerifyDatabaseVersion (Config.Connections.Save) failed. Column names in each table must be unique. Column name 'RedirectClipboard' in table 'tblCons' is specified more than once.
```
mRemoteNG version: 1.77.1.27654
SQL Server version: 14.0.2027

Same db setup script as thornt5748. I checked the table and there is no duplicate column.
```
SELECT TABLE_NAME, COLUMN_NAME FROM mRemoteNG.INFORMATION_SCHE...
comments.author: Shananiganeer

comments.snippet:
I have this issue with "Couldn't save connections file as ""!
The given ColumnMapping does not match up with any column in the source or destination." too...

Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.
